summary: The Health Marketplace for All Act of 2025 amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to allow health marketplace pools to be deemed employers for the purpose of offering group health plans or group health insurance coverage. The bill defines requirements for these health marketplace pools, including organization, coverage offerings (including potential prescription drug coverage), geographic considerations, administrative services, member eligibility, and enrollment rules. It clarifies employer and joint employer status related to these pools and makes conforming amendments to the ERISA act.
